explanation:
The correct side PQ is described using its two endpoints: \( Q P \).  
The student wrote QPRS, using four letters instead of two.  

The error stems from misunderstanding how geometric sides are labeled. A side is defined only by its two endpoints, but the student incorrectly concatenated multiple vertex labels from adjacent sides (QP then PR then RS).  

This indicates they treated the single side PQ as part of a sequence of connected sides (QP-PR-RS), misapplying path or perimeter notation to a single segment.  

The primary misconception here is conflating side labeling with multi-segment path descriptions, distinct from angle labeling (which uses three letters with the vertex in the middle) or parallel side notation (which uses matching tick marks).  

The error is specific to side terminology, not angle conventions or parallel notation.
